intro: Ipomopsis pumila, commonly known as the dwarf morning glory, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant features small, hairy leaves and produces delicate, violet or blue-violet flowers that bloom in the early morning. It thrives in rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its botanical characteristics make it well adapted to harsh, dry conditions.
